snippet: Fabiano Caruana is the No. 2 chess player in the United States. He has earned comparisons to Bobby Fischer, who won the World Chess Championship in 1972.
abstract: Fabiano Caruana, No 2 chess player in United States, plays against students from private Manhattan elementary school in matches at Liberty Science in Jersey City; Caruana, who played for Italy for 10 years, is now playing for United States and is seen as integral part of American team that will play at Chess Olympiad in 2016.
lead_paragraph: Fabiano Caruana is the No. 2 chess player in the United States. He has earned comparisons to Bobby Fischer, who won the World Chess Championship in 1972.

headline.main: An American Chess Master, Age 23, Awaits His Turn on a Bigger Stage
headline.print_headline: A Chess Master Returns to Plan His Next Move
